metadata.title: CVE-2014-125017 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability classified as critical was found in FFmpeg 2.0. Thisvulnerability affects the function rpza_decode_stream. The manipulationleads to memory corruption. The attack can be initiated remotely. The nameof the patch is Fixes Invalid Writes. It is recommended to apply a patch tofix this issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-125017` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu5
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu5
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu5
libavcodec58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu5
libavdevice58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu5
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu5
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu5
libavfilter7 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu5
libavformat-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu5
libavformat-extra58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu5
libavformat58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu5
libavutil56 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu5
libpostproc55 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu5
libswresample3 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu5
libswscale5 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.4.1-3ubuntu5').
